meanings.sent1: She carefully reinscribes her name on the cover of the book.
meanings.sent2: The artist reinscribes the ancient symbols onto the stone tablet.
meanings.sent3: The teacher playfully reinscribes the student's messy handwriting to make it clearer.
meanings.sent4: Time reinscribes memories in our minds like a skilled calligrapher.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor reinscribes intricate details on the statue, bringing it back to life.

meanings.sent1: The treaty reinscribes the boundaries between the two countries.
meanings.sent2: The new law reinscribes the rights of citizens to free speech.
meanings.sent3: The family tradition of baking cookies together reinscribes their bond each year.
meanings.sent4: Kindness reinscribes itself in the hearts of those who receive it.
meanings.sent5: The oath of loyalty reinscribes the commitment of the knights to their king.

meanings.sent1: He quickly reinscribes his signature on the document before submitting it.
meanings.sent2: The athlete reinscribes his autograph on the fan's jersey for the second time.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat reinscribes its paw prints on the freshly mopped floor.
meanings.sent4: The rain reinscribes its path on the window, creating a watery design.
meanings.sent5: The artist reinscribes the logo on the product packaging with precision.
